Renato da Veiga Torres

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6293482142485349

Ph.D. Candidate at Technische Universität Chemnitz (2015) M.Sc. Electronics Engineer at USP Sao Carlos (2013) B.Sc. Electronics Engineer at ITA (2003) Experience in Embedded Systems Design for Aeronautic and Automation Networks, Industrial Communications Protocols, Sensor development and Nanocomposite sensors. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2017 - Atual
Strain Sensor Filament and Extruder Design
Descrição: Nowadays, as the increasing demand for wearable devices, the research in flexible conductive materials becomes more and more important and urgent for both consumer and enterprise. The traditional electrode material is mainly metal, which is primarily rigid and heavy metal material and not light and flexible for wearable devices. The most common method to modified metal material property is to reduce the layer thickness or change to ripple structure design, which would be a very complicate production process with high cost. Those methods are very complicated and expensive. Carbon nanotubes and graphene have been shown good flexibility and excellent conductivity. In addition, they have demonstrated chemical stability, thermal stability and optical transparency with great applicational potential in the field of flexible conductive materials. In this research project, the new stretchable filament is made of SBS-rubber and Conductive-TPU in 7:3 ratio with a customized extruder. By repetitively changing the length of filament, the variation of resistance has been recorded and analyzed. in addition, a relatively accurate mathematical model has been developed, according to the elongation ? resistance curve. The study also shows that various aspects of the temperature-resistance response, including non-linear hysteretic behavior and temperature dependence of electrical resistivity, pose challenges to sensor design. Though the accuracy of the stain sensors is still under development, several recommendations are made with regarding to effective device design..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Renato da Veiga Torres - Coordenador / Zehui Cheng - Integrante.

Número de produções C, T & A: 1
2016 - 2017
Automatic Humidity Test Machine using Open Source Hardware
Descrição: The main scope of this project is to automate an existing sample test machine.  Main idea of the sample test machine is to measure the resistance of sample in the existing different humidity environment. And based on the resistance the reliability of the developed sample with the humidity is studied. To measure the Humidity of the developed environment DHT22 (Humidity Sensors) are used. There are 10 different humidity environment developed by different salt chambers. The existing Sample test machine was measured and controlled manually. That results in large manpower and time consumption. The motive of our project is to automate the manual control over the machine. It involves, Reading sensor data, Switching between inputs (Samples), Serial communication of Controller with DMM MX554, Timing control over the machine, Logging Data in SD card and Wi-Fi The developed automated machine initially gets connected to Wi-Fi by reading the user name and password from SD configuration file making the machine soft coded. After self- configuration of Wi-Fi it asks for the user-defined time the machine need to be operated. As soon the users define the time and start the machine the process begin. The process involves the successive reading of ten reference sensor and samples from one to ten and storing it in SD card and logging to Wi-Fi for future interpretation along with the Real time clock..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (2) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Renato da Veiga Torres - Coordenador / Jagan Athi Lingam Murugaraj - Integrante / Manish Sudeshkumar - Integrante.
2016 - 2017
Investigation of Resistance and Elongation Dependency for Latex/Carbon Nanotubes Composites / Development of Nanocomposite based Sensing Filaments
Descrição: The purpose of this research project is the fabrication of a Nano-composites based stretchable filament strain sensor and its characterization, also the optimization of a labor-extruder is an important part during the research. As the rising demand of wearable device, the stretchable sensors are getting more valuable and widely demanded. So this research about a stretchable sensor become very necessary. In this project, multi-walled Carbon Nanotubes(MWCNT), graphene and silver powder were applied as conductive filler and natural rubber(NR), polycaprolactone(PCL) and SBS as stretchable polymer matrix. Even a kind of conductive material for 3D printer was chosen to help us find the way to make the stretchable filament. All of them was mixed with different concentration to do the comparison. Both wet spinning method and extrusion (melt spinning) method were applied, also, a pneumatic device and a special made extruder were used in the experimental process. The characterization of samples includes Temperature-Resistance examination and Length-Resistance examination. The program to do the temperature test has been processed and a platform to realize the switch, which can let 5 samples be measured at the same time, was designed and factored..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Renato da Veiga Torres - Coordenador / Junyi Liang - Integrante.

Número de produções C, T & A: 1
2016 - 2017
Firmware development for an Industrial Signal Light with IO-Link as a wired communication
Descrição: Development of embedded firmware for an industrial stack light with an IO-link interface as a wired communication. This firmware interfaces and controls the functions of a multi-segment RGB Signal Tower used in factory floor and industrial process automation of greater complexity giving more flexible usage along with sequence of terminal commands. External actions or controls of hardware activate the embedded firmware functions. This embedded firmware specifically has communication connection to other devices such as TIDA-00979, TIDA-00339 stacked on MSP430FR4133 LaunchPad for functionality of an application device to be fulfilled. In Factory Automation, there are often ?signal lights? called industrial signage, which indicates the visual/optical status or state on a factory floor. This will be an access control (e.g. red, amber and green) or level indication for a fluid processes..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Renato da Veiga Torres - Coordenador / Bhavani Ananda - Integrante / Alexander Weiler - Integrante.
2016 - 2017
Development of Smart Health Monitoring System for Solar Panels
Descrição: Our complex world has already started utilizing renewable energies for pollution free development of all the aspects of our lifestyle. And these consumptions are growing fast with respect to the dependencies upon upgradable technologies around us. The very common and most widely renewable energy is solar energy. For this purpose, the system which generates power by the solar energy needs to be monitored, analyzed, maintained their efficiencies. This research project is dedicated to the development of smart health monitoring system for solar panels. This system uses Metering IC as CS5460 which monitors and acquires the power generation data by solar panels for every finite duration and in different scenarios as per the different climatic conditions like a sandstorm, winter-snow, rain etc., and on the basis of different geographical locations tropical regions, desserts, Asiatic regions etc. And the transfers these real-time data with fixed time intervals through a communication device as Bluetooth to any storing device like PC, laptop or smart phone in different formats like .xls flies, .csv files etc. And with the help of this, a user can check the performance of the installed solar panels from anywhere within the Bluetooth range..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (2) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Renato da Veiga Torres - Coordenador / Mohammad Tawsif Ahmed Ansari - Integrante / Rohit Prasad - Integrante.
2016 - 2017
Communication Strategies for Sensor Data Acquisition in Smart Textile
Descrição: Wearable electronics provides a personal systems environment and our physiological status monitored. Usually the system is based on a textile wearable interface implemented by integrating sensors, microcontroller, and connections within the fabric. Significant progress has been achieved in the area of wearable electronics. Fibers, yarns, fabrics and other structures with added-value functionality have been successfully developed for technical and/or high performance end-uses. The basic building blocks are already in place in the field of smart textiles and clothing. This work presents the prototype of measuring the human body temperature and humidity. By analyzing the sensor principles and working, the best sensor in performance and cost was chosen. Also the position of the sensor placed in human body for the accurate measurement of the parameters..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Renato da Veiga Torres - Coordenador / Sahana Mallappanahally Shivaswamy - Integrante.
2015 - 2016
Stretchable strain sensor based on composites applied over textile
Descrição: The scope of this research project is the realization of a nanocomposites based stretchable strain sensor. Stretchable sensors have a rising demand in the textile industry, especially in the field of smart textiles. In this research, the sensor is modelled around integration with polyester, but the same nanocomposites can be modelled for different dimensions and materials. Its composition includes, natural rubber (NR) latex as the polymer base, Multi-walled Carbon Nanotubes (MWCNT) as filler and a surfactant solution in water as the mixing agent. Elongations up to 100% was performed successfully and it is possible to achieve higher elongations with different geometries. Several other experiments on relaxation times and hysteresis have also been performed. Material characterizations such as percolation threshold, I-V curves, UV-Vis spectroscopy and AFM imaging have been performed. A simple and cheap device for elongation and electrical resistance acquisition of sensors with different dimensions has also been proposed and realized..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Renato da Veiga Torres - Coordenador / Anirudh Venugopalarao - Integrante.

Número de produções C, T & A: 1
